basics.name: Matthew Stephenson
basics.label: Games Programmer
basics.summary:
Hi, I'm Matt. I'm a Programmer at Sumo Digital.
I have an MSc in Games Software Development from Sheffield Hallam University, and I love graphics and engine programming.
In my spare time enjoy reading literature and music production.

courses: Project: Remastering Animation Systems (PlayStation to PlayStation 4).
PS4 Engine/Game Development (GNM/GNMX) - Hogs of War: Reheated Team
Special Techniques For Graphics (Graphics Pipeline programming w/DX11)
Hardware Oriented SE (Custom Memory Management, Optimisation w/SIMD Instruction Sets...)
DirectX11 & PhyreEngine (for the PlayStation 4) w/ C++
C++ optimisation, Assembler Languages (x86, PowerPC for PlayStation 3, ARM)
Web Applications Development: HTML, js/jQuery, PHP, MySQL Databases

highlights: Sackboy: A Big Adventure (2020 - PS4/PS5) - Joined later in project lifecycle to assist with physics/interaction performance & graphics improvements.

work.summary:
Titles - Hogs of War: Reheated.
Platforms - PlayStation 4.
Continuing on from my work on the game's engine in the first half of the year, and as part of my MSc project, I worked on implementing new engine and graphical features using Sony's SDKs (such as the GNM & GNMX APIs) including:
Electronic Patient Record & Patient Administration System development.
highlights: C#, js/jQuery Silverlight, ASP .NET & Classic ASP, some VBS front end development.
Tools: SQL Server Manager, VisualStudio, Continuous Integration w/ TeamCity

awards.title: First place (The Red Kite Games Award for Game Technology)
awards.summary: For work porting Hogs of War (Infogrames, 2000), to a fully custom PlayStation 4 game and rendering engine. For more info, see here!

awards.title: First place (End of Year Show)
awards.summary: Selected as best game for the BSc final year category. See Retrospective Ghost Detective for more details.
